sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from 'react'; import '../App.css'; import { Card, CardDeck } from 'react-bootstrap'; import{ BrowserRouter, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; class CairnCare extends Component { render(){ return (

Cairn Care

Cairn Grooming

Hair cutting

I have gone into a proffesional groomer and had their haircut at home, espeially make sure to make apts with your groomer a ways before the hoildays, as some book out for months around the holiday season. I have found that a hair cutting technic refferd to as hand stripping alows the cairn to retian their wirey hair like texture and in doing so gives them a waterproof type layer of fur. Every cairn is alittle different when it comes to gettting a hairbuzzerhair cut. I had my sire hairbuzzer haircut when he was younger in age and his hair was very soft, but it is not as good at keeping him warm or waterproof. Although, i never got my sires hair cut with a hand strippers his hair now after well over a year has become more wirey in some spots, despite only cutting with hair buzzers. My dams however are all hand stripped but i did hair buzz one, one time when younger and it stunted her hair growth, thats the last time she got hairbuzzed.

Nail Trimming

This is something i recemmed for a groomer as well, but you know your getting closer to the time to get nails cut when its been awhile and you can hear their nails tap on the floor. Cairns have nails that are black so you cant see

Shedding

I have found when the season changes from like from winter to summer that Cairns will shed quite a bit. Brushing their coat during the seasons changing can significatly reduce shedding, normally around once a week hair brushing well help alot.

Positive Reienforcment Training

Positive Reienforcment Trainging or PRT i feel is the best and only way to train any breed, big or small. The overall concept behind it is only rewarding postitve behavoir and discouraging any negitive or bad behavoir. While training using the PRT method no pyshical abuse like slapping or hitting should ever be done, or needed. PRT is more effective then any other training method i have found and will never require slapping hitting or shocking. Again this goes for cairns all the way up too mastifs, you never need to hit a dog to teach it. When training avoid using their main source of food as a reward, alotherwise this can lead to food bowl agression.

Vacines & medications

Do what your veternariny reccemnds as certain vacines are more crueasial to have in different parts of the country then others. Certain parts of the country have different types of potiental dangers. Some parts of the country have wood ticks others do not, some have more species of paracitic worms do to climite and winter tempeture allowing some paracites to live in thrive in some areas. Some grousom facts about paracites like the heart worm is commonly transmitted from being on a miscitos mouth before the miscitos bits your puppy. I do not regualry treated mine for fleas or ticks and never had problems. When i know i will traveling with them and they will be using shared pet relief areas i do have them treated.

); } } export default CairnCare;
